newsitem.title: CROATIA: Croatian interbank rates hold in livelier trade.
newsitem.headline: Croatian interbank rates hold in livelier trade.

text.p: Croatian money market rates held in Wednesday's morning trade as banks asked for fresh kuna funds, dealers said.
They put morning trade at 37.9 million kuna of which 27 million were bought by one large bank.
All were call money loans, granted at a steady 10.5 percent rate, save for a smaller placement struck at 11 percent.
Demand at 40 million kuna slightly overshot supply at 38.5 million, but it could not be entirely met as borrowers and lenders failed to agree on terms.
In Tuesday's overnight trade one savings bank bought five million kuna to maintain its mandatory reserve.
